questions.question: A magnet in which a magnetic field is produced through electric current is called an _____.
questions.explanation: An electromagnet is a type of magnet in which magnetic field is produced through electric current.

questions.question: The branch of physics which deals with the magnetic effect of electric current is called _____.
questions.explanation: Electromagnetism is the branch of physics dealing with magnetic effects of electric current.

questions.question: An electromagnet consists of a _____ iron piece called the core.
questions.explanation: An electromagnet consists of a soft iron piece, called the core.

questions.question: An electromagnet is a _____ magnet which retains magnetism only when current flows through it.
questions.explanation: An electromagnet is a temporary magnet which retains the property of magnetism only when electric current passes through it.

questions.question: Permanent magnets are usually made of _____ materials.
questions.explanation: Permanent magnets are usually made of hard materials.

questions.question: Temporary magnets are usually made of _____ materials.
questions.explanation: Temporary magnets are usually made of soft materials.

questions.question: Bar magnets and horse-shoe magnets are examples of _____ magnets.
questions.explanation: Examples of permanent magnets are bar magnets and horse-shoe magnets.

questions.question: Depending on shape, electromagnets are of two types - bar-shaped and _____ magnets.
questions.explanation: Electromagnets are of two types - bar-shaped and U-shaped magnets.

questions.question: The end of the electromagnet where current flows in clockwise direction acts as the _____ pole.
questions.explanation: The end where current flows in clockwise direction acts as the south pole.

questions.question: The end of the electromagnet where current flows in anticlockwise direction acts as the _____ pole.
questions.explanation: The end where current flows in anticlockwise direction acts as the north pole.

questions.question: In an electromagnet, _____ copper wire is wound around the core.
questions.explanation: An insulated copper wire is wound in a coil around the soft iron core.

questions.question: An iron nail gets converted into an electromagnet when _____ flows through it.
questions.explanation: An iron nail gets converted into an electromagnet when current flows through it.

questions.question: The strength of an electromagnet is directly proportional to the amount of _____ flowing through it.
questions.explanation: The strength of an electromagnet is directly proportional to the amount of electric current flowing through it.

questions.question: The strength of an electromagnet is directly proportional to the number of _____ per unit length of the coil.
questions.explanation: The strength of an electromagnet is directly proportional to the number of turns per unit length of the coil.

questions.question: Electromagnets are used in cranes to lift heavy loads of scrap iron and _____.
questions.explanation: Electromagnets are used in cranes to lift heavy loads of scrap iron and steel.

questions.question: Electromagnets are used in _____ trains.
questions.explanation: Electromagnets are used in bullet trains.

questions.question: An electric bell is a useful application of an _____.
questions.explanation: An electric bell is a useful application of an electromagnet.
questions.source_section: The Electric Bell - Application of Electromagnet

questions.question: In an electric bell, the hammer attached to the armature hits the _____ to produce sound.
questions.explanation: The hammer attached to the armature hits the gong and sound (bell ring) is produced.
questions.source_section: The Electric Bell - Application of Electromagnet

questions.question: The armature in an electric bell is made of _____.
questions.explanation: The electromagnet attracts the armature made of iron towards itself.
questions.source_section: The Electric Bell - Application of Electromagnet

questions.question: In an electric bell, the _____ pulls the armature back to its original position.
questions.explanation: The spring pulls the armature back to its original position.
questions.source_section: The Electric Bell - Application of Electromagnet

questions.question: The phenomenon of producing current in a conductor due to change in magnetic lines of force is called electromagnetic _____.
questions.explanation: This phenomenon is called electromagnetic induction.

questions.question: The current produced by electromagnetic induction is called _____ current.
questions.explanation: The current so produced is called induced current.

questions.question: Components of an electric bell are fitted on a flat wooden or _____ board.
questions.explanation: The components are fitted on a flat wooden or plastic board.
questions.source_section: The Electric Bell - Application of Electromagnet

questions.question: When current flows through the coil of an electromagnet, the core behaves like a _____.
questions.explanation: When electric current is passed through the coil, the core behaves like a magnet.

questions.question: Electromagnets are used for separation of iron ore and its _____.
questions.explanation: Electromagnets are used for separation of iron ore and its impurities.

questions.question: Electromagnets are used in preparation of _____ magnets.
questions.explanation: Electromagnets are used in preparation of permanent magnets.

questions.question: Electromagnets are used in loading _____ with iron.
questions.explanation: Electromagnets are used in loading furnaces with iron.

questions.question: The terminals of an electric bell are labelled as T1 and _____.
questions.explanation: The terminals T1 and T2 of the bell are connected to a battery through a push button switch.
questions.source_section: The Electric Bell - Application of Electromagnet

questions.question: When the switch is turned off, the electromagnet loses its _____.
questions.explanation: When the switch is turned off, the flow of current stops and the electromagnet loses its magnetism.

questions.question: Permanent magnets retain their magnetic properties even without the influence of an external _____ field.
questions.explanation: Permanent magnets retain their magnetic properties even without the influence of an external magnetic field.

questions.question: Temporary magnets behave as magnets only in the presence of a strong _____ field.
questions.explanation: Temporary magnets behave as magnets only in the presence of a strong magnetic field.

questions.question: Electromagnets are used in electrical appliances such as telephones, electric motors and electric _____.
questions.explanation: Electromagnets are used in electrical appliances such as telephones, electric motors and electric bells.

questions.question: In an electric bell, when the armature loses contact with the contact screw, the _____ breaks.
questions.explanation: Due to displacement of the armature, it loses contact with the contact screw, which breaks the circuit.
questions.source_section: The Electric Bell - Application of Electromagnet

questions.question: Electromagnets are used in removing steel _____ from patient's wounds.
questions.explanation: Electromagnets are used for removing steel splinters from patient's wounds.

questions.question: Electromagnets are used in audio and video _____.
questions.explanation: Electromagnets are used in audio and video tapes.

questions.question: As the current flowing through the coil decreases, the electromagnet becomes _____.
questions.explanation: As the amount of current flowing through the coil decreases, the electromagnet becomes weaker.

questions.question: If the number of turns per unit length are less, a _____ electromagnet is obtained.
questions.explanation: If the number of turns per unit length of the coil are less, a weak electromagnet is obtained.

questions.question: An electric current can produce a _____ field.
questions.explanation: An electric current produces a magnetic field, and the reverse effect is also possible.

questions.question: The two ends of a wire in an electromagnet are connected to a battery through a _____.
questions.explanation: The two ends of a wire are connected to a battery through a switch.

questions.question: Electromagnets are examples of _____ magnets.
questions.explanation: Electromagnets are examples of temporary magnets.

questions.question: For electromagnetic induction to occur, there must be _____ motion between the magnet and conductor.
questions.explanation: Relative motion between magnet and conductor is essential for electromagnetic induction.

questions.question: The core of an electromagnet should be made of _____ iron, not steel.
questions.explanation: Soft iron is used because it loses magnetism quickly when current stops.

questions.question: In an electric bell, the _____ is attached to the hammer.
questions.explanation: The hammer is attached to the armature, so when armature moves, hammer strikes the gong.
questions.source_section: The Electric Bell - Application of Electromagnet

questions.question: The _____ coating must be removed from wire ends before connecting to battery.
questions.explanation: The plastic coating (insulation) must be removed from wire ends to make electrical contact.

questions.question: Soft iron has low _____, meaning it cannot retain magnetism without current.
questions.explanation: Low retentivity means the material loses magnetism quickly when the magnetizing force is removed.

questions.question: In an electric bell, the electromagnet is _____ shaped.
questions.explanation: A U-shaped electromagnet is used in an electric bell.
questions.source_section: The Electric Bell - Application of Electromagnet

questions.question: The _____ screw in an electric bell makes contact with the armature to complete the circuit.
questions.explanation: The contact screw touches the armature to complete the electrical circuit.
questions.source_section: The Electric Bell - Application of Electromagnet

questions.question: MRI machines in hospitals use powerful _____ to create images of body organs.
questions.explanation: MRI (Magnetic Resonance Imaging) uses strong electromagnets for medical imaging.

questions.question: Reversing the direction of current in an electromagnet reverses its _____.
questions.explanation: When current direction is reversed, north and south poles of the electromagnet swap positions.

questions.question: The hammer in an electric bell keeps striking due to the make-and-_____ mechanism.
questions.explanation: The make-and-break mechanism causes repeated hammer strikes as circuit is alternately completed and broken.
questions.source_section: The Electric Bell - Application of Electromagnet

questions.question: Electromagnets in cranes can be _____ off to release the load.
questions.explanation: Unlike permanent magnets, electromagnets can be switched off to release attracted objects.

questions.question: A _____ magnet has both poles covered or hidden by plastic or metal.
questions.explanation: Single-pole labelled magnets actually have both poles, with one covered by adhesive or casing.

questions.question: The wire in an electromagnet is insulated to prevent _____ circuits between turns.
questions.explanation: Insulation prevents short circuits between adjacent turns of the coil.

questions.question: _____ energy from the battery is converted to electrical energy to power the electromagnet.
questions.explanation: A battery converts chemical energy stored in it to electrical energy.

questions.question: Maglev trains use electromagnets for magnetic _____.
questions.explanation: Maglev (magnetic levitation) trains float above the track using electromagnetic forces.

questions.question: The magnetic field is strongest at the _____ of an electromagnet.
questions.explanation: Like any magnet, the magnetic field of an electromagnet is strongest at its poles.

questions.question: Electromagnets can attract magnetic materials like iron, steel, nickel and _____.
questions.explanation: Electromagnets attract ferromagnetic materials including iron, steel, nickel, and cobalt.

questions.question: In the electromagnet activity, paper clips are attracted at the _____ of the nail.
questions.explanation: The iron nail attracts paper clips at its ends, which act as the magnetic poles.

questions.question: The push _____ switch in an electric bell circuit controls when the bell rings.
questions.explanation: A push button switch connects the battery to the bell circuit when pressed.
questions.source_section: The Electric Bell - Application of Electromagnet

questions.question: A _____ test requires comparing results with a control experiment.
questions.explanation: A fair test in science requires testing with and without the variable being studied.

questions.question: When current stops flowing, the soft iron core gets _____ instantly.
questions.explanation: Soft iron loses its magnetism (gets demagnetized) immediately when current is switched off.

questions.question: Faster change in magnetic flux produces _____ induced current.
questions.explanation: The magnitude of induced current depends on the rate of change of magnetic flux.

questions.question: _____ wire is commonly used for making electromagnet coils due to its good conductivity.
questions.explanation: Copper wire is used because copper is an excellent electrical conductor.

questions.question: If both magnet and conductor are stationary, the induced current is _____.
questions.explanation: Without relative motion, there is no change in magnetic flux, so no current is induced.

questions.question: The gong in an electric bell is made of _____ to produce clear sound.
questions.explanation: A metal gong produces a clear ringing sound when struck by the hammer.
questions.source_section: The Electric Bell - Application of Electromagnet

questions.question: Telephone speakers and microphones use _____ to convert between sound and electrical signals.
questions.explanation: Electromagnets in telephones convert electrical signals to sound and vice versa.

questions.question: Doubling the current through an electromagnet _____ its strength.
questions.explanation: Since strength is directly proportional to current, doubling current doubles strength.

questions.question: U-shaped electromagnets have both poles on the _____ side.
questions.explanation: The U-shape brings both poles close together on the same side, making them more effective.

questions.question: In scrap yards, electromagnets are used to _____ iron and steel from other waste.
questions.explanation: Electromagnets attract iron and steel, separating them from non-magnetic waste.

questions.question: Closely wound coils have more turns per _____ length, increasing magnetic strength.
questions.explanation: More turns per unit length of core increases the magnetic field strength.

questions.question: _____ uses electromagnets to record and store data on magnetic tapes.
questions.explanation: Audio and video recording equipment uses electromagnets to magnetize tape for data storage.

questions.question: Steel is not used as electromagnet core because it has high _____ and retains magnetism.
questions.explanation: Steel retains magnetism even after current stops, making it unsuitable for temporary magnets.

questions.question: The _____ of a conductor in a magnetic field produces induced current.
questions.explanation: Movement of conductor relative to magnetic field causes change in magnetic flux, inducing current.

questions.question: Electric bells operate on _____ current from batteries or transformers.
questions.explanation: Most electric bells work on direct current (DC) supply.
questions.source_section: The Electric Bell - Application of Electromagnet

questions.question: _____ are used to secure wire ends to battery terminals in the electromagnet activity.
questions.explanation: Tape is used to connect and secure the wire ends to the battery terminals.
